title: News Minute: Here is the latest Illinois news from The Associated Press
text:
News Minute: Here is the latest Illinois news from The Associated Press - Wandtv.com, NewsCenter17, StormCenter17, Central Illinois News- Member Center: News Minute: Here is the latest Illinois news from The Associated Press Posted: Updated: 
GROTON, Conn. (AP) - First lady Michelle Obama will christen a Navy attack submarine at a Connecticut shipyard on Saturday that is named after her home state of Illinois. The USS Illinois is the 13th in the Virginia class of submarines, capable of anti-submarine warfare and surveillance. 
CHICAGO (AP) - Critics are blasting moves to end a Chicago anti-gang program called CeaseFire, which sent former gang members and felons to intervene in feuds that could turn violent. The operation has become yet another casualty of budget problems sweeping the state. 
WAUKEGAN, Ill. (AP) - Former Illinois Gov. George Ryan is calling for legislation that would keep convicts from being labeled as felons the rest of their lives. Ryan, who spent several years behind bars on corruption charges, said Friday that the "felon" tag is a deterrent to those seeking jobs. 
LAS VEGAS (AP) - An airport official says a commercial jetliner from Chicago landed safely in Las Vegas on Friday afternoon after reporting a possible problem with the aircraft braking and steering system. No injuries were reported from the in-flight emergency aboard United flight 519 from O'Hare to Las Vegas.
